title: WHIRLING F3 ORB / pinball workshop
description:
1. This was a pinball workshop.
2. Was the Whirling-in-Rags part of the doomed commercial area task gained.

dialogueTree.title: Logic: "So this is where they brought fault..."
dialogueTree.text: So this is where they brought faulty pinball machines to fix them up -- a long time ago. Everything is covered with dust now...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks around the dus..."
links.text: The lieutenant looks around the dusty, crowded room, inspecting the tools on the shelf.

links.title: You: ""Looks like they gave up on fixing..."
links.text: "Looks like they gave up on fixing the pinball machines at some point."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""At some point -- twenty years ago?..."
links.text: "At some point -- twenty years ago? Fifteen maybe. Before pinball went out of vogue."

links.title: Logic: "Yes. Pinball hasn't enjoyed a heyda..."
links.text: Yes. Pinball hasn't enjoyed a heyday for fifteen or twenty years.

links.title: You: ""Doesn't look like that pinball mac..."
links.text: "Doesn't look like that pinball machine will ever get fixed."

links.title: You: ""This used to be a... pinball works..."
links.text: "This used to be a... pinball workshop."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like it. I'm guessing Martin..."
links.text: "Looks like it. I'm guessing Martinaise North 22 used to be a pinball arcade before it became a hostel. There are machines left over..." He taps his foot.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "A creak, some dust falls off a shel..."
links.text: A creak, some dust falls off a shelf.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Downstairs in the hall -- next to..."
links.text: "Downstairs in the hall -- next to the main door. One of them even works. I've seen one of the Hardies bang away at it."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Remember the *Dicemaker*?! Then tha..."
links.text: Remember the *Dicemaker*?! Then that means...

links.title: You: ""Whirling-in-Rags was once the East..."
links.text: "Whirling-in-Rags was once the East Delta Pinball arcade. This is all left over from that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes -- as the novelty dicemake..."
links.text: "Ah, yes -- as the novelty dicemaker said." He makes a note in his notebook. "This has absolutely nothing to do with the case, I'm sure. But I do like a nice little *connection*."

links.title: Logic: "As the Dicemaker said, yes; it all..."
links.text: As the Dicemaker said, yes; it all fits. Not that it has anything to do with the case, but it is a nice connection!

links.title: Inland Empire: "But then it went bankrupt... your s..."
links.text: But then it went bankrupt... your skin crawls from making the connection!

links.title: Logic: "And it has been forgotten. Now, the..."
links.text: And it has been forgotten. Now, there is only one working machine in the main hall -- the rest is lost to dust.

links.title: Logic: "Yes. Martinaise North 22 used to be..."
links.text: Yes. Martinaise North 22 used to be a pinball arcade.

links.title: You: ""Could this mean the Whirling-in-Ra..."
links.text: "Could this mean the Whirling-in-Rags really *is* part of the Doomed Commercial Area?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If that's true then our *cafeteria..."
links.text: "If that's true then our *cafeteria manager* is not going to like it." He looks around. "We should tell him what we found up here -- *omitting* that suspicion."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""He does not appear to be the kind..."
links.text: "He does not appear to be the kind of man who likes his establishment to be part of a neighbourhood ghost story. About *bankruptcy*."

links.title: Logic: "Stupid superstition. But still -- i..."
links.text: Stupid superstition. But still -- it would be *interesting* to see what the cafeteria manager thinks of this...

links.title: Inland Empire: "It's not a ghost story. It's a curs..."
links.text: It's not a ghost story. It's a curse -- and Garte ought be made knowledgeable so he can perform counter-spells.

links.title: Logic: "Yes. It would mean that."
links.text: Yes. It would mean that.

links.title: Logic: "And Garte would not like that. He s..."
links.text: And Garte would not like that. He should probably be made aware that his establishment is part of the neighbourhood ghost story.

links.title: You: "Not interested. [Discard thought.]"
links.text: Not interested. [Discard thought.]

dialogueTree.title: Logic: "This seems to be some kind of works..."
dialogueTree.text: This seems to be some kind of workshop. For fixing up pinball machines -- a long time ago. Everything is covered with dust now...
